Our Services

Legal Extractions

We don't just remove teeth; we remove legal impediments. Cease & Desist orders, restraining orders, and partnership dissolutions served with clinical precision.

Procedural Fillings

Closing legal loopholes is like filling a cavity. We use only the most durable composite arguments to ensure a permanent, watertight seal on all contracts.

Malocclusion Mediation

For misaligned partnerships and contractual bites that don't quite fit. We achieve perfect harmony through structured, binding arbitration. 93% of cases result in a satisfactory fit.

Case Files

Patterson v. Gummy King Industries

Finch & Molar successfully sued a bubblegum company for emotional distress and false advertising. The plaintiff, Mr. Herbert Patterson, suffered a crisis of faith when the 'Royal Crown Jewel' gum, which promised 'flavor lasting an eternity,' lost its taste in under four minutes. Dr. Finch argued that "the promise of eternity is a binding oral contract, not a marketing suggestion."

Verdict: Settled for a formal apology printed on 1.2 million gum wrappers and a lifetime supply of mint-flavored dental floss.

Class Action v. "Captain Krunch's Honey'd Morsels"

A class-action lawsuit representing over 3,000 individuals against a popular breakfast cereal for its flagrant disregard for enamel integrity. Our forensics proved the cereal's texture exceeded the Mohs hardness of deciduous teeth. Dr. Finch famously cross-examined the company's mascot, a cartoon pirate, for three hours until he admitted his own teeth were "professionally bonded veneers."

Verdict: Out-of-court settlement including a $2.5M fund for preventative dental care and a mandatory warning label: "May abrade tooth surfaces and existential certainty."

Finch & Molar v. GloboChem Corp.

Not a client case, but a firm initiative. We identified deep-seated corruption within GloboChem that required a thorough and invasive legal procedure. Over 18 months, our team performed what we term a 'corporate root canal,' removing necrotic management, debriding fraudulent accounts, and filling the ethical void with a court-mandated charter. The procedure was painful, but the prognosis is good.

Verdict: Forced restructuring, 3 executives disbarred from industry, and the company's lobby plant was replaced with a non-toxic fern.

Frequently Asked Questions

Do I need a legal problem or a dental problem?

All legal problems are, at their core, dental problems. An unstable contract is a form of structural decay. A slanderous remark is an infection of the truth. A corporate merger is a complex bridge procedure. We will find the cavity. You need only open your mouth... metaphorically.

What are your fees?

We operate on a retainer, which is non-refundable and must be paid in gold bullion or certified cashier's check. Our rate is $950/hour, billed in 6-minute increments, the standard unit of both legal practice and thorough tooth-brushing.

What is the WiFi password?

The network SSID is 'FinchGuest'. The password is 'TheFlossTrot'. Access is granted only upon successful physical demonstration of the maneuver (a simple box step combined with an alternating up-down hand motion) to our paralegal, Janice. She is a harsh but fair judge.

Is Dr. Finch a real dentist and a real lawyer?

Dr. Alistair Finch is a retired Doctor of Dental Surgery (D.D.S.) from the University of Pennsylvania School of Dental Medicine. He is also a practicing Esquire (Esq.), having passed the New York State Bar on his first attempt, citing its 'disappointingly low structural integrity'. He founds his practice on the axiom that both fields seek to remedy painful decay through precise, often uncomfortable, intervention.
